medical_history.chief_complaint: Asymptomatic opacity detected on routine chest x-ray film.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The opacity was detected on a routine chest x-ray, with a previous chest radiograph 4 months earlier showing no abnormalities. The patient reported stable dyspnea on moderate exertion for many months. Two months after the initial scan, he experienced persistent pleuritic chest pain on the right side, without fever or cough, which was new.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Controlled atrial fibrillation, adult-onset diabetes mellitus, hypertension, benign prostatic enlargement.
